p: Sociocs is a single inbox for all of your customer communications.
Sociocs offers a FREE FOREVER plan. Visit pricing page for plan options.
When you see a mention of channel on Sociocs, it means a communication mechanism available for conversation with your audience. For example, SMS is a channel, so are Google Reviews.
We support â€” Google Business Messages, Google Play Reviews, Google Reviews & Questions, Facebook (Messenger, Reviews & Comments), Telegram, Text / SMS, Viber, Web chat, Website Forms, WhatsApp.
Bulk messaging is supported for sending text / SMS to multiple recipients. It also allows dynamic parameters to personalize sent messages.

l: Does the bulk messaging allow sending images?
p: Yes. Our bulk text messaging also supports sending one image along with the text message. It's also known as MMS. Supported image types are JPG, JPEG, PNG and GIF.

l: Does Sociocs have a mobile app?
p: Yes. Mobile apps are available for Android and iOS platforms. You can download for your phone here.

l: Would I get a notification on a new incoming message?
p: Yes. Our web app and mobile apps generate notifications when new messages are received in your inbox.

l: What do you mean by web app?
p: Web app is our website / web portal available at app.sociocs.com.
Getting started with Sociocs is very easy.
Go to https://app.sociocs.com.

To join with your Google account click "Continue with Google" and select your Google account, or to join with other email address click "Continue with Email", provide your information, and complete email verification.
On the "Select a plan page" click "Start a FREE Trial" for a paid plan or select the FREE plan by clicking "Continue with the Free Plan".
You will be taken to "Add a new channel" page. You should connect your messaging, social, review or texting account there. More information for each channel available later in the docs.
Click on the dropdown menu on top right.
Select Business profile on the left side.
Enter new business name.
Click Update.
Open drawer menu on top left.
Tap on Profile & settings.
Select Business profile in the list.
Enter new business name.
Tap on Update.

l: How to go to My profile?

p: Click on the dropdown menu on top right.
Select My profile on the left side.
Open drawer menu on top left.
Tap on Profile & settings.
Select My profile in the list.
Click on pencil icon next to your name.
Enter new name.
Click on check icon.
Tap on pencil icon next to your name.
Enter new name.
Tap on check icon.
Click on pencil icon next to the current profile image.
Select a new image.
Tap on pencil icon next to the current profile image.
Select a new image.
All Preference changes are applicable at the organization level, which means they apply to all the users in your business account.
Click on the dropdown menu on top right.
Select Preferences on the left side.
Open drawer menu on top left.
Tap on Profile & settings.
Select Preferences in the list.
This preference is applicable only for the web app. It has no effect on the mobile app.
When this setting is turned on, pressing enter key while composing a new message or replying to a message will send the message instead of adding a line break in the message.

Set a default value for the auto archive setting. When on, customer messages are archived as soon as a reply is sent. You can also turn auto archive on or off, for a particular conversation, at the time of sending a reply.

Profile bar is what you see on the right most side of the screen when viewing a conversation (i.e. sender's profile, notes, and follow-ups). You can select which tab should be opened by default for your team.
Profile tab
Notes tab
Follow-ups tab
These are additional preferences for the Follow-ups tab.

l: Open new follow-up form automatically when the follow-ups tab is opened
p: When this setting is turned on, instead of showing follow-ups for a conversation by default, it opens a new follow-up reminder form. This makes it very convenient for your team to add new follow-up reminders.
Given you already receive a reminder in the inbox on the follow-up due date, and also there is a separate page for viewing upcoming and past follow-ups, keeping this setting on is recommended.

l: Default tags for the new follow-up form
p: If there are tags you use frequently for new follow-up reminders (e.g. leads), adding them here would always auto-populate them when a new follow-up reminder form is opened.
We send notifications when new messages arrive in your inbox. You can enable or disable these notifications. We recommend that you keep them on so that you can reply to your customers quickly.

Enabling or disabling notifications takes effect only on the browser you are using. To change notifications setting for a different browser, log in to Sociocs on that browser, and follow the same steps.
When you go to the inbox for the first time, you will receive a confirmation popup to enable notifications for the browser you are using.
Notifications popup
Click Allow on the confirmation popup.
You may receive another confirmation popup (from your browser this time) to give notifications access to Sociocs. Click Allow.
Click on the dropdown menu on top right.
Select Notifications on the left side.
Toggle Receive notifications on this browser switch to on.
We do not recommend disabling notifications.
Click No Thanks on the confirmation popup.
Click on the dropdown menu on top right.
Select Notifications on the left side.
Toggle Receive notifications on this browser switch to off.
Notifications are automatically enabled on the Android app.
Go to your device's notifications setting, and turn notifications on for Sociocs.
Go to your device's notifications setting, and turn notifications off for Sociocs.
After you log in to the app, you will receive a confirmation popup to allow notifications from Sociocs. Tap on Allow.
Go to your device's notifications setting, and turn notifications off for Sociocs.
Tap Don't Allow on the notifications confirmation popup.
Go to your device's notifications setting, and turn notifications off for Sociocs.
